ICSU Asia & Pacific http://www.icsu.org/asia-pacific These are the search results for the query, showing results 1 to 15. SIMSEA discussions provide numerous examples for Future Earth http://www.icsu.org/asia-pacific/news-centre/news/simsea-discussions-provide-numerous-examples-for-future-earth Examples of research and development activities adopting a multidimensional approach in the MSEA region The brainstorming pre-scoping workshop on the sustainability initiative for the marginal seas of East Asia (SIMSEA) drew many examples of research and development activities that would provide the basis of a more integrated programme of research and development in the marginal seas of East Asia.

Please view the downloadable presentations below for details.

Workshop introduction: Lourdes Cruz

Workshop objectives: Toshio Yamagata

What is Future Earth from the Asian Perspective?: Nordin Hasan

Activities of IOC/WESTPAC: Wenxi Zhu

Activities of PICES: Hiroaki Saito

Activities of APEC Climate Center: Chin-Seung Chung

Achievement of LOICZ and the Satoumi Concept: Tetsuo Yanagi

Views from Coastal Ecosystems: Porfirio Miel Alino

Views from Integrated Coastal Zone Management of Thailand: Somkiat Khokiattiwong

Views from Living Marine Resource Management and the Coral Triangle Project: Annadel Cabanban

Views from Oceanography of Malaysia: Nor Aieni Haji Mokhtar

The East Asian Seas \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd A bumpy road to sustainable ocean development: Chua Thia-Eng

New strategy for coastal marine science for establishment of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdFuture Oceans\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd: Nobuyuki Miyazaki

Rapid Arctic Warming in Recent Decades: Seong-Joong Kim et al

BPPT MCCOE Near Future Ocean Climate: Fadli Syamsudin

Reviews of Oceanography in Vietnam: Vo Si Tuan

]]> No publisher Tengku Sharizad Tengku Dahlan International Research Collaboration Biodiversity Basic science Sustainable development Global sustainability research Earth system science Polar research Environment Global environmental change Monitoring and observations Applied science Science for Policy Ecosystems Research and development Regional Offices 2014-03-04T04:35:00Z News Item Executive Summer School on Global Environmental Policy http://www.icsu.org/asia-pacific/news-centre/news/executive-summer-school-on-global-environmental-policy The Global Environmental Policy Programme (GEPP) of the University of Geneva Summer School on Global Environmental Policy will be from 31st August to 12th September 2014 The Global Environmental Policy Programme (GEPP) of the University of Geneva invites you to its Executive Summer School on Global Environmental Policy. The programme is\ufffd\ufffdorganised in partnership with UNEP from 31st August to 12th September 2014 in Geneva, Switzerland.\ufffd\ufffdThe Summer School provides a special opportunity for participants from both the public and the private sectors to enlarge their competences in order to address complex environmental issues. Beyond enlarging the knowledge base of each participant, the modules of this transdisciplinary programme bridge the gap between scientific knowledge and concrete decision-making, problem-solving and negotiation skills.

Not more than 25 participants with diverse origins and professional backgrounds will be selected. The closing date for applications is 30th April 2014. More information about GEPP, including the programme of the Executive Summer School held in September 2013, can be consulted at: www.unige.ch/gepp/ess.

]]> No publisher Mohd Nordin Hasan Environment Science for Policy 2014-02-04T21:55:00Z News Item POGO-SCOR Visiting Fellowship programme for 2014 http://www.icsu.org/asia-pacific/news-centre/news/pogo-scor-visiting-fellowship-programme-for-2014 Call for applications for Fellowships under the Partnership for Observation of the Global Oceans (POGO)-SCOR Visiting Fellowship programme for 2014. The Partnership for Observation of the Global Oceans (POGO) \ufffd\ufffdhas announced the POGO-SCOR Visiting Fellowship programme for 2014. The deadline for applications is 10 January 2014. The scheme is designed to promote training and capacity building leading towards a global observation scheme for the oceans, and is aimed at scientists, technicians, graduate students (PhD) and post-doctoral fellows involved in oceanographic work at centres in developing countries and countries with economies in transition (e.g. Commonwealth of Independent States, Eastern Europe).

Priority is given to applicants in early stages of career development. The fellowship offers the opportunity to visit other oceanographic centres for a short period (1 to 3 months) for training on any aspect of oceanographic observations, analyses, and interpretation. It provides financial support to cover the return airfare from the fellow's home country to the host institution, and a contribution towards accommodation and subsistence for the period of the visit.

For more information and details on how to apply please see: http://ocean-partners.org/training-and-education/pogo-scor-fellowship

Please e-mail pogoadmin@pml.ac.uk if you have any queries.

]]> No publisher Mohd Nordin Hasan International Research Collaboration Capacity building Earth system science Environment Global environmental change Monitoring and observations Assessments Interdisciplinary Bodies 2013-11-28T20:21:09Z News Item APN report on MAIRS strategic planning workshop on Future Earth in Asia http://www.icsu.org/asia-pacific/news-centre/news/apn-report-on-mairs-strategic-planning-workshop-on-future-earth-in-asia Mission report of MAIRS strategic planning workshop on Future Earth The Asia-Pacific Network for Global Change Research (APN) has published a mission report of the Monsoon Asia Integrated Regional Study (MAIRS)-organised meeting to input into Future Earth and to develop a strategic science plan for a \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdFuture Asia\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. The meeting was hosted by the Hong Kong Polytechnic University, Hong Kong, China. Representatives from APN, RIHN, ICSU-ROAP and key natural and social scientists in Asia attended the meeting. To date, there have been several Future Earth meetings and workshops in the region. Following the release of the Future Earth initial design report in April 2013, the present meeting was organised to discuss a MAIRS draft strategic plan for Future Earth in Asia, which will be announced at the MAIRS Open Science Conference (OSC) in Beijing in 2014. You can read about the workshop on the APN website (http://www.apn-gcr.org/)\ufffd\ufffdor download the full report of the meeting from the link provided below.

APN Mission Report of MAIRS workshop

]]> No publisher Mohd Nordin Hasan International Research Collaboration Food security Health and wellbeing Basic science Sustainable development Global sustainability research Energy Science for Policy Earth system science Hazards and disasters Environment Global environmental change Applied science Renewable energy Ecosystems Strategic planning Social sciences 2013-10-30T04:15:00Z News Item World Weather Open Science Conference http://www.icsu.org/asia-pacific/events/partner-organization-events/world-weather-open-science-conference The International Council for Science is co-organizing the first World Weather Open Science Conference, to be held in Montreal, Canada, in August 2014 This conference will bring together the weather science and user communities for the first time to review the state-of-the-art and map out the scientific frontiers for the next decade and more.

]]> No publisher Johannes Mengel Environment Foresight Earth system science Monitoring and observations 2013-09-23T13:39:58Z Event Sri Lanka Coordinating Workshop on Future Earth http://www.icsu.org/asia-pacific/news-centre/news/top-news/coordination-workshop-on-future-earth Sri Lanka holds national coordination workshop on Future Earth in Colombo on 17 and 18 September 2013 The Sri Lankan Coordinating Secretariat for Science, Technology and lnnovation (COSTI) will hold a coordinating workshop on Future Earth on 17 and 18 September 2013 in Colombo to develop an appropriate Future Earth research agenda for Sri Lanka. Discussions centred around a framework that will enable the identification, design and development of modalities to co-implement research activities related to Future Earth, including demand driven R&D by scientists, policy makers and end-users. The workshop will discuss opportunities and challenges for implementing Future Earth in Sri Lanka, and explore the best possible ways of establishing a national interface for Future Earth. The Chair of the Scientific Committee of Futrue Earth, Mark Stafford-Smith who was not able to participate sent in a video message to address participants. The Sri Lanka Senior Minister of Scientific Affairs, Tisa Vitarana and Minister of Environment and Sustainable Energy gave welcome addresses. The President of ICSU Yuan Tseh Lee gave a keynote speech entitled "Sustainable transformation of human society". Heinz Gutscher and Nordin Hasan spoke about Future Earth at the beginning of the workshop. Materials from the workshop can be downloaded from the links given below.

Brochure

Mark video

Nordin presentation

Heinz Gutscher

]]> No publisher Mohd Nordin Hasan Foresight Basic science Sustainable development Global sustainability research Earth system science Strategic planning Environment Global environmental change Applied science Science for Policy Research and development Climate research 2013-09-17T10:40:00Z News Item Southeast and East Asia Ministerial Forum on Environment and Health http://www.icsu.org/asia-pacific/news-centre/news/south-and-east-asia-ministerial-forum-on-environment-and-health Third Ministerial Regional Forum on environment and health in Southeast and East Asian countries The 3rd Ministerial Regional Forum on environment and health in Southeast and East Asian countries\ufffd\ufffdis being held in Kuala Lumpur on 9 and 10 September 2013. The Forum is preceded by the 7th High Level Officials' Meeting which was opened by the United nations Environment Programme (Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific) and the World Health Organization (WHO) Regional Office for Western Pacific. The Forum is held annually to discuss issues related to \ufffd\ufffdthe environment and health in Southeast and East Asia. At this meeting a science presentation entitled "Why do ecosystems matter for human health" was delivered by Emeritus Professor Zakri Hamid, the Science Advisor to the Prime Minister of Malaysia. Zakri was until September 2011 a member of the Executive Board of ICSU.

]]> No publisher Mohd Nordin Hasan Environment Science for Policy Health and wellbeing Applied science 2013-09-10T07:55:00Z News Item ICSU ROAP establishes collaborative link with UNU IIGH http://www.icsu.org/asia-pacific/news-centre/news/icsu-roap-establishes-collaborative-link-with-unu-iigh ICSU ROAP and United Nations University International Institute for Global Health discusses collaboration Nordin Hasan, Director of ICSU ROAP met with the Director of the United Nations University, International Institute for Global Health (UNU IIGH) on 23 August 2013\ufffd\ufffdto discuss matters of common interest in the Asia-Pacific region. Progress with the implementation of ICSU\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds new interdisciplinary science program on health and wellbeing in the changing urban environment using the systems approach was the main topic of concern to both organizations.

UNU-IIGH is well placed to collaborate on this new science program and help build capacity for system thinking in population health research and practice.\ufffd\ufffd Next month, Profs Capon and Hasan are speaking at the first international conference on\ufffd\ufffdUrban Dynamics and Health in Paris which is being organised by University Paris Ouest \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Nanterre La Defense http://www.etouches.com/ehome/ColloqueInternational2013/101190/?&language=eng

More information about the meeting with IIGH may be obtained from http://iigh.unu.edu/events/meeting-with-international-council-for-sciences-regional-office-for-asia-and-the-pacific-icsu-roap/

]]> No publisher Mohd Nordin Hasan International Research Collaboration Health and wellbeing Capacity building Environment Global environmental change Applied science Science for Policy Education Regional Offices 2013-08-29T08:45:00Z News Item ISIS Malaysia and ICSU ROAP Future Earth Roundtable http://www.icsu.org/asia-pacific/news-centre/news/top-news/isis-malaysia-and-icsu-roap-future-earth-roundtable ISIS Malaysia and ICSU ROAP organise discussion on Future Earth implementation in developing countries The Institute for Strategic and International Studies (ISIS) Malaysia and ICSU ROAP will organise a Roundtable on Future Earth on Wednesday 21 August 2013 in Kuala Lumpur. It will be attended by about 40 invited researchers and stakeholders who will discuss the implementation of Future Earth in developing countries with particular reference to Malaysa. It will provide participants the opportunity to learn more about this emerging international research program on global sustainability and where possible identify gaps in current research on global change in developing countries. The Roundtable will pay particular attention to how science can inform policy processes for sustainability in the future and discuss how co-design and co-production of knowledge may be achieved in Malaysia. It is anticipated that the deliberations from the Roundtable will be published as a Policy Brief on Future Earth for Developing Countries.

A copy of the programme of the Roundtable may be obtained here:

Roundtable Programme

]]> No publisher Mohd Nordin Hasan Basic science Sustainable development Global sustainability research Earth system science Environment Global environmental change Applied science Science for Policy Regional Offices 2013-08-20T01:20:00Z News Item ICSU ROAP assists MAIRS prepare for Future Earth http://www.icsu.org/asia-pacific/news-centre/news/mairs-organises-strategic-plan-preparation-for-future-earth ICSU ROAP helps Monsoon Asia Integrated Research Study (MAIRS) prepare a strategic plan on Future Earth at a workshop in Hong Kong The MAIRS Scientific Steering Committee (SSC) meeting in Guangzhou in March 2013 \ufffd\ufffddecided that MAIRS would prepare,\ufffd\ufffdin partnership with key partners, a strategic science plan to chart how MAIRS will adapt to and engage in research for Future Earth in Asia. The partnership would consist of MAIRS, the Research Institute on Humanity and Nature (RIHN), the Asia Pacific Network on Global Change Research (APN) and the ICSU Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific (ICSU-ROAP). It was \ufffd\ufffdagreed that the preparation of such a plan would assist agenda setting for Future Earth across Asia. It was proposed that the plan be launched at the MAIRS open science conference in April 2014. A draft should be ready for discussion during the Future Earth planning workshop that will be held in Beijing in September 2013.

The workshop will involve about a dozen experts, and will be hosted by The Hong Kong Polytechnic University on 31 July to 2 August 2013. The draft plan, will also be circulated to the scientific community in Asia and the Pacific for comment and suggestions. ROAP will be represented at the workshop by its Director Nordin Hasan..

]]> No publisher Mohd Nordin Hasan International Research Collaboration Climate research Strategic planning Environment Applied science Regional Offices 2013-07-29T01:45:00Z News Item ICSU participates in 12th Pacific Science Inter-congress http://www.icsu.org/asia-pacific/news-centre/news/icsu-participates-in-12th-pacific-science-inter-congress Announcing ICSU ROAP's contributions to the 12th Pacific Science Inter-congress in Suva, Fiji ICSU will participate in the 12th Pacific Science Inter-congress from 8 to 12 July 2013 in Suva, Fiji. The theme of the inter-congress is Science for Human Security and Sustainability in the Pacific Islands and Rim. Nordin Hasan, Director, ICSU Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific (ROAP) will deliver a keynote address entitled Future Earth:: A new international platform for research on global sustainabillity. The Inter-congress is organized by the Pacific Science Association and the University of the South Pacific where it will be held. A Panel Discussion has been scheduled to discuss the implementation of Future Earth in the Pacific Island countries. Nordin will also be speaking about the ICSU initiative on urban health and wellbeing and presenting a paper written with Katrina Proust of the Australian National University on the development of pilot projects on the systems approach to urban health and wellbeing research in the Asia-Pacific region. For more details of the inter-congress, please visit http://www.psi2013.usp.ac.fj/

]]> No publisher Mohd Nordin Hasan Food security Sustainable development Environment Regional Offices Global sustainability research Hazards and disasters Global environmental change Ecosystems Research and development Biodiversity Health and wellbeing Scientific Associates Applied science Basic science Traditional knowledge Energy Earth system science Climate research Science for Policy Education Social sciences 2013-07-05T07:35:00Z News Item Future Earth Regional Workshop for Africa http://www.icsu.org/asia-pacific/icsu-africa/future-earth-regional-workshop-for-africa The International Council for Science, with financial support from the Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (Sida) organised the Future Earth Regional Workshop for Africa, which was in Cape Town, South Africa on 31 October \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 02 November 2012. The workshop brought together about 50 global environmental change scientists from within and outside Africa. It provided a platform for these scientists and other stakeholders working on global environmental change research across disciplines to discuss and elaborate recommendations for the development of Future Earth on the continent. Discussions focused on the research priorities particularly relevant for the continent that Future Earth should address, and the governance and institutional arrangements necessary to successfully deliver Future Earth in the region.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd

]]> No publisher Bongani Mahlalela Environment Global environmental change Data and information Education Climate research 2012-11-06T07:30:00Z News Item Visit Regional Office UNISDR in Panama http://www.icsu.org/asia-pacific/icsu-latin-america/what-we-do/priority-areas/natural-hazards/visit-regional-office-unisdr-in-panama/visit-regional-office-unisdr-in-panama On 21 June, 2012 Kerstin Schmidt-Verkerk visited the Regional Office for the Americas of the United Nations International Strategy for Disaster Reduction (UNISDR) in Panama City. During the meeting, synergies between the work of UNISDR in LAC and the ICSU ROLAC priority area natural hazards were sought.

In particular three upcoming events on natural hazards in the LAC region were discussed:

Foro Latinoamericano de Reducci\ufffd\ufffdn de Riesgo del Desastre en la Educaci\ufffd\ufffdn Superior (REDULAC), \ufffd\ufffd28-30 August, 2012 - \ufffd\ufffdPanama City, Panama, co-organised by UNISDR

Regional Workshop on Disaster Risk Management in Latin America and the Caribbean, 3-5 September, 2012 - Buenos Aires, Argentina, co-organized by ICSU ROLAC

Regional Platform for Disaster Risk Reduction in the Americas, \ufffd\ufffd29-31 October, 2012 - Buenos Aires, Argentina, co-organised by UNISDR.

]]> No publisher Danita Garcia Environment Global environmental change Hazards and disasters 2012-07-10T20:25:00Z Page Visit CONICET http://www.icsu.org/asia-pacific/icsu-latin-america/what-we-do/priority-areas/natural-hazards/visit-conicet/visit-conicet From 18-20 June, 2012 Kerstin Schmidt-Verkerk visited the National Scientific and Technical Research Council (CONICET) of Argentina in Buenos Aires.

CONICET Argentina \ufffd\ufffdhas been a National Member of ICSU since 1931. Furthermore, Arturo J. Mart\ufffd\ufffdnez, Head of Global Programs at CONICET, has been a member of the ICSU Regional Committee for Latin America and the Caribbean since 2010.\ufffd\ufffdThe main objective of the visit was the planning of the Regional Workshop on Disaster Risk Management in Latin America and the Caribbean, which will take place from 3-5 September, 2012 in Buenos Aires, Argentina.

This workshop is co-organized by the ICSU/ISSC/ISDR Integrated Research on Disaster Risk (IRDR) programme, the Regional Office for Latin America and the Caribbean of the International Council for Science (ICSU ROLAC) and CONICET Argentina.

The project was awarded a 2012 ICSU grant in the context of the ICSU grants programme.

]]> No publisher Danita Garcia Environment Health and wellbeing Hazards and disasters 2012-07-10T20:10:00Z Page Visit to the Biology Institute, UNAM http://www.icsu.org/asia-pacific/icsu-latin-america/what-we-do/priority-areas/biodiversity/visit-institute-of-biology-unam/visit-institute-of-biology-unam On 4 May, 2012 Kerstin Schmidt-Verkerk visited Susana Magall\ufffd\ufffdn, researcher at the Biology Institute of the UNAM and member of the DIVERSITAS bioGENESIS Scientific Committee. The aim\ufffd\ufffd of this meeting was to argue about the Capacity Building Workshop\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdEvolutionary Approaches to Biodiversity Science\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, which took place in June, 2012 in Bonito, Brazil.

During this meeting, future collaboration and sinergies between DIVERSITAS bioGENESIS and ICSU ROLAC were discussed.
